text: The Page selector will output pretty much all of the contents that you’d want from a page selector, you just have to specify what you want. To list everything, you can pretty print the field with `{{ page_by_id(module.page_field) | pprint }}`. It sounds like what you want is something like `{{ page_by_id(module.page_field).absoluteUrl }}`
<@U2PDTMH53> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2PDTMH53/F9HM75SN9/screen_shot_2018-03-02_at_13.05.16.jpg|the Feedback button is on top of the files>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
lol, I’ve submitted feedback in the past, just so I could see what was behind the button
It def could have better placement
or while the feedback button is up , the scrollable div could just have padding-bottom:200px; or so and it wouldn’t be an issue
Yeah.. add a class to the body when it is visible. Then do stuff.
Just realized that if you use the Page selector it shows ALL pages in your portal, this includes archived/draft pages. Seems like it should only be showing pages that are published?? :flushed:
Or at least indicate the status of the page to the end user so they don't select a page that isn't live.
What do you mean by page selector? are you meaning when you are viewing dependents?
This page selector that you can add into modules.
It lists ALL pages, even if they are archived or not published.
Ahh 100% agree with you, thank you for clarifying.
I can see the benefit of listing all, i think that they should have some indicator though to show published or not

Also, I don't know if it's just because we have a lot of stuff in our Design Manager but I would love to see a better template file management solution, maybe something similar to the normal File Manager in HubSpot? Or there needs to be an option added to the Actions menu to "Move Template(s)" so that we can more easily move templates between folders and to move more than 1 at a time. As we go to reorganize everything it's proving to be pretty cumbersome. 

As a side note; can we use FTP access to rearrange templates or is that still limited to just File Manager??
